tokenomics1: DRV official launch happened on the 23th of April 2021. The Derive DAO token will be used to incentivise liquidity providers on the Derive Finance platform as well as to get users involved in the governance of the protocol.
circulatingSupply: The circulating supply will be 0 at launch and the initial release rate will be around 2m DRV per day.
riskAdminKeys: Derive is currently managed through a 2 of 3 multisig address shared between the company's founders, while we transition to a fully fledged DAO governance model.
riskAudits: Our smart contracts have been audited by
auditResults: Read the full report available on Github.
auditResults2: Please keep in mind that although security audits do reduce risk greatly, they donâ€™t completely eliminate it.
riskAudits4: Using Derive as an exchange user should be significantly less risky, but keep in mind there are still risks.
riskIntro: The role of liquidity provider (LP) carries intrinsic risks. Before engaging in any activity with the Derive protocol, we recommend
riskIntro5: to ask any question you might have.
riskLossOfPeg: It might happen occasionally that the liquidity of assets within the same pool gets unbalanced. In such case, upon withdrawing liquidity, a LP might face loss of one of the assets provided.

venusProtocol: Each asset supported by the Venus Protocol is integrated through a vToken contract, which is an EIP-20 compliant representation of balances supplied to the protocol. By minting vTokens, users earn interest through the vToken's exchange rate, which increases in value relative to the underlying asset, and gain the ability to use vTokens as collateral.
